titles: An antidote against the venome of The snake in the grass, or, The book so stiled and the Christian people called Quakers vindicated from its most gross abuses and calumnies in certain reflections detecting the nameless author's malice, outrage, and persecution against the said people : unto which is annex'd a brief examination of the author's second book stil'd Satan dis-rob'd : also, some notice taken of his discourse for The divine institution of water-baptism.
author: Whitehead, George, 1636?-1723.
notes: "Impartial reader" signed: G.W. and signed on p. 185, George Whitehead.
Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
keywords: Leslie, Charles, 1650-1722. --  Snake in the grass.
